tic_tac_toe.title: Your Turn: Phonics
tic_tac_toe.directions: Match each word to the sentence it completes. If you are correct, place your X on the board by clicking a square. Three spaces in a row wins.

item.text: Stefan felt[bewilderment] on his first day at his new school.
The [outlandish] behavior was unacceptable.
You are a(n) [enabler] if you encourage someone’s bad habits.
The frown on her face showed her obvious [displeasure].
Helen performed a [graceful] dance solo.
Leaves were scattered [evenly] on the lawn.
Ruthie tried hard, but she was [unsuccessful] at beating the record.
Our puppy needs lot of [encouragement] to sleep on its own bed.
She was [disagreeable] because she was in a bad mood.
The fireman received a certificate to honor his [fearlessness].
As a(n) [requirement] of the job, teachers must be certified in CPR.
I get a(n) [endless] amount of love from my old dog, Pepper.
We [unpack] our suitcases the minute we get home.
Uncle Jack made a(n) [unplanned] stop at our house yesterday.
My dad still has a(n) [display] case for his high school trophies.
Dylan [easily] won the spelling be; he’s a great speller!
Some songs are [ageless]; people from every generation enjoy them.
The puppy showed its [discontent] by howling.
Ryan [readily] joined in the soccer game.
Emma told us [breathlessly] about her new best friend!
We bought a(n) [enlargement] of the photo to hang on the wall.
The package was [unopened] so we could still return it.
Kevin looked over a magazine [disinterestedly] at the doctor’s office.
Gary tripped [clumsily] over his untied shoelaces.
